definitions.definition: A party or thing which compensates, pays or otherwise provides a compensation
Any device used to compensate for something, notably to achieve a better balance .

A building control device used to deliver the compensation relationship or curve between the air temperature outside a building and the temperature of water or air provided to spaces or zones within the building for purposes of heating or cooling .
examples: Compensators ensure less heat is provided to a room on a warmer day. They may be implemented mechanically, electronically or in software.

definitions.definition: One of several small magnets placed in the binnacle to neutralize the effect of the ship's metal on the compass

main_definition: ( literally ) A party or thing which compensates, pays or otherwise provides a compensation
secondary_definitions: Any device used to compensate for something, notably to achieve a better balance .

A building control device used to deliver the compensation relationship or curve between the air temperature outside a building and the temperature of water or air provided to spaces or zones within the building for purposes of heating or cooling .
( nautical ) One of several small magnets placed in the binnacle to neutralize the effect of the ship's metal on the compass
